derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English (recorded only in the verbal noun snyflung 'mucus'), from snofl, in the same sense; compare with snuffle

entry.tran: (令人讨厌地)啜泣，抽抽噎噎地哭，抽鼻子
entry.def: If someone is snivelling, they are crying or sniffing in a way that irritates you.

example.ex: Billy started to snivel. His mother smacked his hand.

means.word_mean: 2. the act of breathing heavily through the nose (as when the nose is congested)
2. snuff up mucus through the nose

sentences.sentence: "Stop snivelling--you got yourself into this mess!"

auth_sentence.content: Wipe your nose and don't snivel.

sentences.en: I’ve warned you. If you fail, don’t come snivelling back to me.
sentences.cn: 我已警告过你：你如果失败, 别哭哭啼啼回来找我。
